titleStmt.title: Bridge Phase 2: Witness fMS, Collation unit C18

body.ab: <milestone unit="tei:p"/><lb n="c57-0015__main__19"/> I lay on my straw but I could not <lb n="c57-0015__main__20"/> sleep – I thought of the occurences of <lb n="c57-0015__main__21"/> the day.– What cheifly struck me was <lb n="c57-0015__main__22"/> the gentle manners of these people, and <lb n="c57-0015__main__23"/> I longed to join them but dared not.— <lb n="c57-0015__main__24"/> I remembered too well the treatment I <lb n="c57-0015__main__25"/> had suffered the night before fro<mdel>n</mdel>m<lb n="c57-0015__main__26"/> the barbarous villagers and resolved <lb n="c57-0015__main__27"/> whatever <del rend="strikethrough" sID="c57-0015__main__d3e3230"/>I<del eID="c57-0015__main__d3e3230"/><del next="#c57-0015.03" rend="strikethrough" sID="c57-0015__main__d3e3233"/>should<del eID="c57-0015__main__d3e3233"/><metamark function="insert">^</metamark>course of conduct I might<del rend="strikethrough" sID="c57-0015__main__d3e3245" xml:id="c57-0015.03"/>afterwards<del eID="c57-0015__main__d3e3245"/><del next="#c57-0015.04" rend="strikethrough" sID="c57-0015__main__d3e3248"/>think it<del eID="c57-0015__main__d3e3248"/>hereafter consider<lb n="c57-0015__main__28"/><del rend="strikethrough" sID="c57-0015__main__d3e3257" xml:id="c57-0015.04"/>right to do<del eID="c57-0015__main__d3e3257"/>it proper to pursue that for the present I would <lb n="c57-0015__main__29"/> remain quietly in my hovel watching <lb n="c57-0015__main__30"/> and endeavouring to discover the motive<lb n="c57-0016__main__1"/> of their <del rend="strikethrough" sID="c57-0016__main__d3e3281"/>motions<del eID="c57-0016__main__d3e3281"/> actions.—<milestone unit="tei:p"/><lb n="c57-0016__main__2"/> The<mdel>y</mdel><metamark function="insert">^</metamark>cottagers arose the next morning before <lb n="c57-0016__main__3"/> the sun;– The young woman arranged the <lb n="c57-0016__main__4"/> cottage &<del rend="strikethrough" sID="c57-0016__main__d3e3308"/>per<del eID="c57-0016__main__d3e3308"/> prepared the food; & the <lb n="c57-0016__main__5"/> youth mounted on a large strange animal <lb n="c57-0016__main__6"/><del rend="strikethrough" sID="c57-0016__main__d3e3315"/>road<del eID="c57-0016__main__d3e3315"/> rode away. This day was passed in <lb n="c57-0016__main__7"/> the same routine <del rend="strikethrough" sID="c57-0016__main__d3e3323"/>and<del eID="c57-0016__main__d3e3323"/>as the preceeding one. <lb n="c57-0016__main__8"/> The <del rend="strikethrough" sID="c57-0016__main__d3e3332"/>young<del eID="c57-0016__main__d3e3332"/> young man was constantly <lb n="c57-0016__main__9"/> employed out of doors and the girl in <lb n="c57-0016__main__10"/> various laborious occupations within..— The old <lb n="c57-0016__main__11"/> man whom I soon perceived to be blind <lb n="c57-0016__main__12"/> employed his leisure hours in playing <lb n="c57-0016__main__13"/> on his instrument or in <del rend="strikethrough" sID="c57-0016__main__d3e3355"/>pesively<del eID="c57-0016__main__d3e3355"/><lb n="c57-0016__main__14"/> contemplation – Nothing could exceed <lb n="c57-0016__main__15"/> the love & respect that the younger <lb n="c57-0016__main__16"/> cottagers <del rend="strikethrough" sID="c57-0016__main__d3e3367"/>bore<del eID="c57-0016__main__d3e3367"/>shewed towards this venerable <lb n="c57-0016__main__17"/> old man – They performed towards <metamark function="insert">^</metamark>him every <lb n="c57-0016__main__18"/> little office of <del rend="strikethrough" sID="c57-0016__main__d3e3393"/>love<del eID="c57-0016__main__d3e3393"/>affection& duty with gentleness; <lb n="c57-0016__main__19"/> and he rewarded them by his benevo <lb n="c57-0016__main__20"/> lent smiles. <del rend="strikethrough" sID="c57-0016__main__d3e3404"/>B<del eID="c57-0016__main__d3e3404"/><milestone unit="tei:p"/><lb n="c57-0016__main__21"/> They were not however entirely <lb n="c57-0016__main__22"/> happy–The <del rend="strikethrough" sID="c57-0016__main__d3e3414"/>youth<del eID="c57-0016__main__d3e3414"/> young<del rend="strikethrough" sID="c57-0016__main__d3e3417"/>er<del eID="c57-0016__main__d3e3417"/> man<del rend="strikethrough" sID="c57-0016__main__d3e3420"/>d<del eID="c57-0016__main__d3e3420"/>& his <lb n="c57-0016__main__23"/> companion, often retired into a corner <lb n="c57-0016__main__24"/> of their common room and wept. I saw <lb n="c57-0016__main__25"/> no cause for this unhappiness but <lb n="c57-0016__main__26"/> I was deeply affected by it – If such <lb n="c57-0016__main__27"/> lovely creatures were miserable it was <lb n="c57-0016__main__28"/> less strange that <del rend="strikethrough" sID="c57-0016__main__d3e3436"/>alone<del rend="strikethrough" sID="c57-0016__main__d3e3438"/>d<del eID="c57-0016__main__d3e3438"/><del eID="c57-0016__main__d3e3436"/> I, an imperfect <lb n="c57-0016__main__29"/> and solitary being should be wretched—<lb n="c57-0017__main__1"/> yet why were these gentle beings un <lb n="c57-0017__main__2"/> happy – they poss<metamark function="insert">^</metamark>essed a delightful house <lb n="c57-0017__main__3"/><lb n="c57-0017__left_margin__1"/>for such <metamark function="insert">^</metamark>it was <mdel>it</mdel><mdel>to</mdel>in my eyes) and every <lb n="c57-0017__main__4"/> luxury. they had a fire to warm <lb n="c57-0017__main__5"/> them when chill and delicious viands<lb n="c57-0017__main__6"/> when hungry– they were dressed <lb n="c57-0017__main__7"/><del rend="strikethrough" sID="c57-0017__main__d3e3517"/>in clothes that kept t<del eID="c57-0017__main__d3e3517"/> in excel <lb n="c57-0017__main__8"/> lent clothes and still more they enjoy <lb n="c57-0017__main__9"/> ed one anothers company & speech — and <del rend="strikethrough" sID="c57-0017__main__d3e3528"/>saw<del eID="c57-0017__main__d3e3528"/><lb n="c57-0017__main__10"/><lb n="c57-0017__left_margin__1"/>interchanged each day looks of affection & kindness– <lb n="c57-0017__main__11"/> What did their tears mean? Did they <lb n="c57-0017__main__12"/> really express pain? I was at first <lb n="c57-0017__main__13"/> unable to solve these questions but <lb n="c57-0017__main__14"/> perpetual attention and time <lb n="c57-0017__main__15"/> explained to me many of the appear <lb n="c57-0017__main__16"/> ances which at first seemed <lb n="c57-0017__main__17"/><del rend="strikethrough" sID="c57-0017__main__d3e3560"/>igmmatic<del eID="c57-0017__main__d3e3560"/>enigmatic. <note resp="#pbs"/>o you pretty Pecksie!<lb n="c57-0018__main__1"/><milestone spanTo="#c57-0018.05" unit="tei:head"/>Chap. 3<lb n="c57-0018__main__2"/><del rend="strikethrough" sID="c57-0018__main__d3e3588"/>It was some time<del eID="c57-0018__main__d3e3588"/><metamark function="insert">^</metamark>A considerable period elapsed before I discovered one <lb n="c57-0018__main__3"/><lb n="c57-0018__left_margin__1"/>of the causes of the uneasiness of this amiable <lb n="c57-0018__main__4"/> family – <mdel>It</mdel><del rend="strikethrough" sID="c57-0018__main__d3e3624"/>Itw<del eID="c57-0018__main__d3e3624"/><metamark function="insert">^</metamark>It was poverty– and they suffered <lb n="c57-0018__main__5"/> that evil in a very distressing degree– Dur <lb n="c57-0018__main__6"/> ring the winter<del rend="strikethrough" sID="c57-0018__main__d3e3646"/>They often had hardly any<del eID="c57-0018__main__d3e3646"/><lb n="c57-0018__main__7"/> their nourishment consisted entirely of bread <lb n="c57-0018__main__8"/><del rend="strikethrough" sID="c57-0018__main__d3e3654"/>and –<del eID="c57-0018__main__d3e3654"/> the vegetables of their garden and the <lb n="c57-0018__main__9"/> milk of one cow which gave very little <lb n="c57-0018__main__10"/> during the <del rend="strikethrough" sID="c57-0018__main__d3e3661"/>hard<del eID="c57-0018__main__d3e3661"/><del rend="strikethrough" sID="c57-0018__main__d3e3664"/>monthes<del eID="c57-0018__main__d3e3664"/> winter when <lb n="c57-0018__main__11"/><del rend="strikethrough" sID="c57-0018__main__d3e3670"/>the<del eID="c57-0018__main__d3e3670"/> its masters could <del rend="strikethrough" sID="c57-0018__main__d3e3673"/>spare<del eID="c57-0018__main__d3e3673"/>scarcelyvery little <lb n="c57-0018__main__12"/> money towards the procur<mdel>i</mdel>e<mdel>ng</mdel><metamark function="insert">^</metamark>any<mdel>of</mdel> food for it. <lb n="c57-0018__main__13"/><del rend="strikethrough" sID="c57-0018__main__d3e3717"/>This state of poverty<del eID="c57-0018__main__d3e3717"/> They often I believe<del rend="strikethrough" sID="c57-0018__main__d3e3721"/>d<del eID="c57-0018__main__d3e3721"/><lb n="c57-0018__main__14"/> suffered the pangs of hunger very poi <lb n="c57-0018__main__15"/> gnantly especially the two younger<del rend="strikethrough" sID="c57-0018__main__d3e3736"/>er part<del eID="c57-0018__main__d3e3736"/><lb n="c57-0018__main__16"/> for <metamark>^</metamark>several times they <del rend="strikethrough" sID="c57-0018__main__d3e3752"/>often<del eID="c57-0018__main__d3e3752"/> placed food before the old <lb n="c57-0018__main__17"/> man when <del rend="strikethrough" sID="c57-0018__main__d3e3759"/>they<del eID="c57-0018__main__d3e3759"/><metamark function="insert">^</metamark><del rend="strikethrough" sID="c57-0018__main__d3e3768"/>were<del eID="c57-0018__main__d3e3768"/><del rend="strikethrough" sID="c57-0018__main__d3e3775"/>themselves in want of it<del eID="c57-0018__main__d3e3775"/><lb n="c57-0018__main__18"/> they had none for <del rend="strikethrough" sID="c57-0018__main__d3e3781"/>their<del eID="c57-0018__main__d3e3781"/> themselves –This <lb n="c57-0018__main__19"/> trait of kindness moved me sensibly. <lb n="c57-0018__main__20"/> I had been accustomed during the night <lb n="c57-0018__main__21"/> to steal a part of their store for my <lb n="c57-0018__main__22"/> own consumption; but when I found <lb n="c57-0018__main__23"/> that in doing this I inflicted pain on the <lb n="c57-0018__main__24"/> cottagers, I abstained, and satisfied my <lb n="c57-0018__main__25"/> self with berries nuts and roots which <lb n="c57-0018__main__26"/> I <del rend="strikethrough" sID="c57-0018__main__d3e3803"/>found<del eID="c57-0018__main__d3e3803"/><mdel>in</mdel>gathered from a neighbouring wood. I <del rend="strikethrough" sID="c57-0018__main__d3e3819"/>found<del eID="c57-0018__main__d3e3819"/><metamark function="insert">^</metamark>discovered also <lb n="c57-0018__main__27"/> another means by which I was able <lb n="c57-0018__main__28"/> to assist their labours. I found that the<lb n="c57-0019__main__1"/> youth spent a great part of each <lb n="c57-0019__main__2"/> day in <del rend="strikethrough" sID="c57-0019__main__d3e3848"/>felling<del eID="c57-0019__main__d3e3848"/> collecting wood for the <lb n="c57-0019__main__3"/> family fire–and during the night I often <lb n="c57-0019__main__4"/> took his tools the <del rend="strikethrough" sID="c57-0019__main__d3e3856"/>com<del eID="c57-0019__main__d3e3856"/> use of which I <lb n="c57-0019__main__5"/> quickly discovered and brought home <lb n="c57-0019__main__6"/><del rend="strikethrough" sID="c57-0019__main__d3e3866"/>for them<del eID="c57-0019__main__d3e3866"/> firing sufficient <metamark function="insert">^</metamark>for the consumption<del rend="strikethrough" sID="c57-0019__main__d3e3881"/>f<del eID="c57-0019__main__d3e3881"/>o<mdel>r</mdel>f seve <lb n="c57-0019__main__7"/> ral days– <milestone unit="tei:p"/><metamark function="paragraph">[</metamark>I remember the first time that I <lb n="c57-0019__main__8"/> did this, the young woman who opened <lb n="c57-0019__main__9"/> the door in the morning <del rend="strikethrough" sID="c57-0019__main__d3e3911"/>was<del eID="c57-0019__main__d3e3911"/>appeared greatly sur <lb n="c57-0019__main__10"/> prisedastonished to see a great pile of wood on <lb n="c57-0019__main__11"/> the outside – she said some words in a <lb n="c57-0019__main__12"/> loud voice, & presently the youth joined <lb n="c57-0019__main__13"/> her who also appeared astonished. <del rend="strikethrough" sID="c57-0019__main__d3e3936"/>and<del eID="c57-0019__main__d3e3936"/><lb n="c57-0019__main__14"/> I observed <del rend="strikethrough" sID="c57-0019__main__d3e3942"/>th<del eID="c57-0019__main__d3e3942"/> with pleasure that he <lb n="c57-0019__main__15"/> did not go to the <del rend="strikethrough" sID="c57-0019__main__d3e3949"/>wood<del eID="c57-0019__main__d3e3949"/><metamark function="insert">^</metamark>forest that day but <lb n="c57-0019__main__16"/> spent it in repairing the cottage & in <lb n="c57-0019__main__17"/> cultivating the garden.—<milestone unit="tei:p"/><lb n="c57-0019__main__18"/><del rend="strikethrough" sID="c57-0019__main__d3e3973"/>Soon after<del eID="c57-0019__main__d3e3973"/><metamark function="insert">^</metamark>By degrees also I made another discovery <lb n="c57-0019__main__19"/><del rend="strikethrough" sID="c57-0019__main__d3e3990"/>which was that<del eID="c57-0019__main__d3e3990"/><lb n="c57-0019__left_margin__1"/><del rend="strikethrough" sID="c57-0019__left_margin__d3e4001"/>to me<del eID="c57-0019__left_margin__d3e4001"/> of still <lb n="c57-0019__left_margin__2"/> greater <lb n="c57-0019__left_margin__3"/> moment <metamark function="insert">^</metamark>to me I <lb n="c57-0019__left_margin__4"/> found<metamark function="insert">^</metamark>that these people <mdel>ha</mdel><mdel>d</mdel>posessed a <lb n="c57-0019__main__20"/><del rend="strikethrough" sID="c57-0019__main__d3e4056"/>means<del eID="c57-0019__main__d3e4056"/>method of communicating their <del rend="strikethrough" sID="c57-0019__main__d3e4063"/>ideas<del eID="c57-0019__main__d3e4063"/>experience & to <lb n="c57-0019__main__21"/>feelings one another by articulate sounds which <lb n="c57-0019__main__22"/> they uttered <del rend="strikethrough" sID="c57-0019__main__d3e4079"/>som<del eID="c57-0019__main__d3e4079"/> —<del rend="strikethrough" sID="c57-0019__main__d3e4085"/>w<del eID="c57-0019__main__d3e4085"/> I <del rend="strikethrough" sID="c57-0019__main__d3e4088"/>often<del eID="c57-0019__main__d3e4088"/> percieved that <lb n="c57-0019__main__23"/> the words they spoke <metamark function="insert">^</metamark>sometimes produced plea <lb n="c57-0019__main__24"/> sure pain, smiles or sadness in the <lb n="c57-0019__main__25"/><lb n="c57-0019__left_margin__1"/>minds &countenances of the hear<mdel>ee</mdel>ers– This was <lb n="c57-0019__main__26"/> indeed a Godlike science and I ardently <lb n="c57-0019__main__27"/><del rend="strikethrough" sID="c57-0019__main__d3e4139"/>wished<del eID="c57-0019__main__d3e4139"/><lb n="c57-0019__left_margin__1"/>desired to become acquainted with it–But <lb n="c57-0019__main__28"/> I was baffled in every attempt <del rend="strikethrough" sID="c57-0019__main__d3e4157"/>they<del eID="c57-0019__main__d3e4157"/>I made for this purpose<lb n="c57-0019__main__29"/> Their pronunciation was quick & the <lb n="c57-0019__main__30"/> words they uttered <del rend="strikethrough" sID="c57-0019__main__d3e4172"/>seemed<del eID="c57-0019__main__d3e4172"/><del rend="strikethrough" sID="c57-0019__main__d3e4175"/>had<del eID="c57-0019__main__d3e4175"/> not having<lb n="c57-0020__main__1"/> any apparent <del rend="strikethrough" sID="c57-0020__main__d3e4191"/>co<del eID="c57-0020__main__d3e4191"/> connexion with <del rend="strikethrough" sID="c57-0020__main__d3e4194"/>the<del eID="c57-0020__main__d3e4194"/> visible <lb n="c57-0020__main__2"/> objects I was unable to discover any clue <lb n="c57-0020__main__3"/> by which I could unrable the mystery <lb n="c57-0020__main__4"/> of their <del rend="strikethrough" sID="c57-0020__main__d3e4206"/>sounds.<del eID="c57-0020__main__d3e4206"/><del rend="strikethrough" sID="c57-0020__main__d3e4211"/>application<del eID="c57-0020__main__d3e4211"/> reference.. By great application how <lb n="c57-0020__main__5"/> ever and after having remained <metamark function="insert">^</metamark>during the space of several <lb n="c57-0020__main__6"/> revolutions of the moon in my hovel <lb n="c57-0020__main__7"/> I discovered the names that were given <lb n="c57-0020__main__8"/> to some of the most familiar objects <lb n="c57-0020__main__9"/><lb n="c57-0020__left_margin__1"/>of discourse, I learned <metamark function="insert">^</metamark>& applied the words <shi rend="underline">fire, </shi><shi rend="underline">mil</shi>k <lb n="c57-0020__main__10"/><shi rend="underline">bread</shi>&<shi rend="underline">wood</shi> I learned also the names <lb n="c57-0020__main__11"/> of the cottagers themsel<mdel>f</mdel>ves– <del rend="strikethrough" sID="c57-0020__main__d3e4291"/>but as<del eID="c57-0020__main__d3e4291"/><lb n="c57-0020__main__12"/> the<mdel>y</mdel><metamark function="insert">^</metamark>youth & his companion had h each of them several but <lb n="c57-0020__main__13"/> the old man had only one which <lb n="c57-0020__main__14"/> was <shi rend="underline">Father</shi> – the girl was call<del rend="strikethrough" sID="c57-0020__main__d3e4322"/>ed Sist<del eID="c57-0020__main__d3e4322"/><lb n="c57-0020__main__15"/> Sister or Agatha and the youth <lb n="c57-0020__main__16"/> Felix. <metamark function="insert">^</metamark><mdel>or</mdel> brother or son I <del rend="strikethrough" sID="c57-0020__main__d3e4344"/>c<del eID="c57-0020__main__d3e4344"/> cannot describe the delight <lb n="c57-0020__main__17"/> I felt when I <del rend="strikethrough" sID="c57-0020__main__d3e4352"/>discovered<del eID="c57-0020__main__d3e4352"/><metamark function="insert">^</metamark>learned the ideas <del rend="strikethrough" sID="c57-0020__main__d3e4365"/>opp<del eID="c57-0020__main__d3e4365"/><lb n="c57-0020__main__18"/> appropriated to each of these sounds <lb n="c57-0020__main__19"/> and was able to pronounce them. <del rend="strikethrough" sID="c57-0020__main__d3e4372"/>But<del eID="c57-0020__main__d3e4372"/><lb n="c57-0020__main__20"/> I <del rend="strikethrough" sID="c57-0020__main__d3e4380"/>learned<del eID="c57-0020__main__d3e4380"/><metamark function="insert">^</metamark>distinguished several other <del rend="strikethrough" sID="c57-0020__main__d3e4393"/>sounds<del eID="c57-0020__main__d3e4393"/> words <lb n="c57-0020__main__21"/> without being able <metamark function="insert">^</metamark>as yet to understand <del rend="strikethrough" sID="c57-0020__main__d3e4410"/>th<del eID="c57-0020__main__d3e4410"/> or <lb n="c57-0020__main__22"/> apply them – <del rend="strikethrough" sID="c57-0020__main__d3e4416"/>Among these<del eID="c57-0020__main__d3e4416"/> Such as <shi rend="underline">good</shi><lb n="c57-0020__main__23"/><shi rend="underline">dearest</shi> – <shi rend="underline">unhappy</shi>.<milestone unit="tei:p"/><lb n="c57-0020__main__24"/> I spent the winter in this manner– <lb n="c57-0020__main__25"/> the gentle manners and beauty of the <lb n="c57-0020__main__26"/> cottagers greatly endeared them to me–When <lb n="c57-0020__main__27"/> they were unhappy I felt depressed and<lb n="c57-0021__main__1"/> I sympathized in their joys. I saw few <lb n="c57-0021__main__2"/> human beings besides them, and if <lb n="c57-0021__main__3"/> any other happened to enter the cottage <lb n="c57-0021__main__4"/> their harsh <del rend="strikethrough" sID="c57-0021__main__d3e4460"/>and rud<del eID="c57-0021__main__d3e4460"/> manners & rude <lb n="c57-0021__main__5"/> gait only enhanced to me <del rend="strikethrough" sID="c57-0021__main__d3e4466"/>th<del eID="c57-0021__main__d3e4466"/><del rend="strikethrough" sID="c57-0021__main__d3e4469"/>my friends<del eID="c57-0021__main__d3e4469"/><lb n="c57-0021__main__6"/> the superior advantages of my friends. <lb n="c57-0021__main__7"/> The <del rend="strikethrough" sID="c57-0021__main__d3e4480"/>Father<del eID="c57-0021__main__d3e4480"/> old man, I could percieve, <lb n="c57-0021__main__8"/> often endeavoured to encourage his <lb n="c57-0021__main__9"/> children as I sometimes found that <lb n="c57-0021__main__10"/> he called them. <metamark function="insert">^</metamark>to cast off their melancholy. He would talk in <lb n="c57-0021__main__11"/> a cheerful accent with an <del rend="strikethrough" sID="c57-0021__main__d3e4506"/>aspect<del eID="c57-0021__main__d3e4506"/>expression of<lb n="c57-0021__main__12"/><del instant="true" rend="strikethrough" sID="c57-0021__main__d3e4515"/>godn<del eID="c57-0021__main__d3e4515"/> goodness that <del rend="strikethrough" sID="c57-0021__main__d3e4520"/>even<del eID="c57-0021__main__d3e4520"/><del rend="strikethrough" sID="c57-0021__main__d3e4523"/>gave<del eID="c57-0021__main__d3e4523"/><metamark function="insert">^</metamark><mdel>me</mdel><del rend="strikethrough" sID="c57-0021__main__d3e4535"/>delight.<del eID="c57-0021__main__d3e4535"/>bestowed pleasure<lb n="c57-0021__main__13"/><lb n="c57-0021__left_margin__1"/>even on me; Agatha listened with respect– her eyes <lb n="c57-0021__main__14"/><del rend="strikethrough" sID="c57-0021__main__d3e4558"/>f<del eID="c57-0021__main__d3e4558"/> sometimes filled with tears which <lb n="c57-0021__main__15"/><metamark function="displacement" xml:id="c57-0021.02"></metamark><lb n="c57-0021__left_margin__1"/>she endeavoured <shi rend="sup">to</shi>wipe<del rend="strikethrough" sID="c57-0021__main__d3e4577"/>d<del eID="c57-0021__main__d3e4577"/> away unpercieved but I general<lb n="c57-0021__main__16"/>ly found that her manners and tone <lb n="c57-0021__main__17"/> were more cheerful after having listen<lb n="c57-0021__main__18"/>end to <del rend="strikethrough" sID="c57-0021__main__d3e4595"/>the<del eID="c57-0021__main__d3e4595"/> the exhortations of her father <lb n="c57-0021__main__19"/> It was not thus with Felix. He was <lb n="c57-0021__main__20"/> always the saddest of the groupe And <lb n="c57-0021__main__21"/> even to my unpractised senses he <lb n="c57-0021__main__22"/> appeared to have suffered more <lb n="c57-0021__main__23"/> deeply than his friends. But if his <lb n="c57-0021__main__24"/> countenance was more sorrowful <lb n="c57-0021__main__25"/> his voice was more cheerful than <lb n="c57-0021__main__26"/><lb n="c57-0021__left_margin__1"/>that of his sister<del rend="strikethrough" sID="c57-0021__main__d3e4626"/>es<del eID="c57-0021__main__d3e4626"/> expecially when he <lb n="c57-0021__main__27"/> addressed the old man—<milestone unit="tei:p"/><lb n="c57-0022__main__1"/> I could mention innumerable instances <lb n="c57-0022__main__2"/> which although slight marked the <del rend="strikethrough" sID="c57-0022__main__d3e4651"/>heart<del eID="c57-0022__main__d3e4651"/>dispositions<lb n="c57-0022__main__3"/><mdel>in</mdel><mdel/>of<del rend="strikethrough" sID="c57-0022__main__d3e4675" xml:id="c57-0022.02"/>which<del eID="c57-0022__main__d3e4675"/> these amiable cottagers shewed <lb n="c57-0022__main__4"/> their dispositions. In the midst of poverty <lb n="c57-0022__main__5"/> and want Felix carried with pleasure <lb n="c57-0022__main__6"/> to his sister the fist little white flower <lb n="c57-0022__main__7"/> that peeped out from beneath the <del rend="strikethrough" sID="c57-0022__main__d3e4697"/>snow<del eID="c57-0022__main__d3e4697"/>snowy<del rend="strikethrough" sID="c57-0022__main__d3e4705"/>white<del eID="c57-0022__main__d3e4705"/> ground<lb n="c57-0022__main__8"/><lb n="c57-0022__left_margin__1"/>Early<mdel>I</mdel>in the morning <del rend="strikethrough" sID="c57-0022__main__d3e4732"/>early<del eID="c57-0022__main__d3e4732"/> before <del rend="strikethrough" sID="c57-0022__main__d3e4735"/>any of the<del eID="c57-0022__main__d3e4735"/><lb n="c57-0022__main__9"/> she had risen he had cleared away the <lb n="c57-0022__main__10"/> snow that obst<metamark function="insert">^</metamark>ructed her path to the <lb n="c57-0022__main__11"/> milkhouse<mdel>–</mdel>; drew water from the well <lb n="c57-0022__main__12"/> and brought the wood from the <del rend="overwritten" sID="c57-0022__main__d3e4770"/><del rend="strikethrough" sID="c57-0022__main__d3e4772"/>outhouse<del eID="c57-0022__main__d3e4772"/><del eID="c57-0022__main__d3e4770"/><metamark function="displacement" xml:id="c57-0022.05">X</metamark><lb n="c57-0022__left_margin__1"/><metamark function="displacement">X</metamark><lb n="c57-0022__left_margin__2"/> outhouse <lb n="c57-0022__left_margin__3"/> where to his <lb n="c57-0022__left_margin__4"/> perpetual <lb n="c57-0022__left_margin__5"/> astonishment <lb n="c57-0022__left_margin__6"/> he found his <lb n="c57-0022__left_margin__7"/> store always <lb n="c57-0022__left_margin__8"/> replenished by <lb n="c57-0022__left_margin__9"/> an invisible <lb n="c57-0022__left_margin__10"/> hand.<lb n="c57-0022__main__13"/> In the day I believe he worked sometimes <lb n="c57-0022__main__14"/> for a neighbouring farmer, <del rend="strikethrough" sID="c57-0022__main__d3e4822"/>for<del eID="c57-0022__main__d3e4822"/>because he <lb n="c57-0022__main__15"/> often went <del rend="strikethrough" sID="c57-0022__main__d3e4833"/>out<del eID="c57-0022__main__d3e4833"/>forth, and did not return <lb n="c57-0022__main__16"/> untill dinner, yet brought no wood <lb n="c57-0022__main__17"/> with him:– at other times he worked <lb n="c57-0022__main__18"/> in the garden but as there was litt<mdel>e</mdel>le<lb n="c57-0022__main__19"/> to do in the frosty season he often <lb n="c57-0022__main__20"/> read to the old man and Agatha. <lb n="c57-0022__main__21"/> This reading had puzzled me extremely <lb n="c57-0022__main__22"/> at first – but by degrees I discovered <lb n="c57-0022__main__23"/> that he uttered many of the same <lb n="c57-0022__main__24"/> sounds when he read as when he talked; <lb n="c57-0022__main__25"/> I conjectured <del rend="strikethrough" sID="c57-0022__main__d3e4871"/>their<del eID="c57-0022__main__d3e4871"/> therefore that he <lb n="c57-0022__main__26"/> found on the paper signs for speech <lb n="c57-0022__main__27"/> which he understood and I ardently longed <lb n="c57-0022__main__28"/> to <del rend="strikethrough" sID="c57-0022__main__d3e4883"/>understand<del eID="c57-0022__main__d3e4883"/><metamark function="insert">^</metamark>comprehend these <del rend="strikethrough" sID="c57-0022__main__d3e4896"/>b<del eID="c57-0022__main__d3e4896"/> also; but how was
